page.title: 10Fire Service Collingham
page.content: The present{fire station }came into use in 1969 and consists of 5 rooms and a large hall to house the engine and equipment.14 men work part-time in shifts making Collingham a full-time station.On average 2 to 3 fires are dealt with each week within their area of 113 sq km. A sub-officer is paid Â£86 a month with extras for attending drill nights and fires.Extra money is also paid if he has to stay at a fire for more than 1 hour.A leading fireman is paid Â£74 a month and a fireman Â£71.75 a month. Modern technology ensures a rapid response to a fire.Each fireman has an {electronic bleeper }to call him in.When at the station there will be a printout on the{teleprinter }giving information about the fire.
